subject: Re: [junit] is adding test classes in mass possible?
msgSnippet: Jeff, It appears that this message hasn t yet been replied to.  Have you looked at the  task available from the ant build tool?  Good luck, David Saff
messageBody:
Jeff,

It appears that this message hasn't yet been replied to. Have you
looked at the <junit> task available from the ant build tool? Good luck,

David Saff

Jeff Schlaver wrote:
> I have been give around 160 separate httpunit test files, instead of
> listing them one line at a time.
> Is there a way I can grab them from the package directory and do a
> mass add of the test cases?
> I was hoping I can loop through all the classes in a package, since
> all the testcases are in the same package.
> (package com.thc.ids.application.hcs.test.CalculatorTest.tests;)
>
> I create a main "driver" test suite as follows, and this is were I
> was hoping to be able to some kind of mass add of the 160 test case
> files. Below is a sample of 4 of the 160.
>
> public class TestLabSuite
> {
> public static void main( String[] args )
> {
> junit.textui.TestRunner.run( suite() );
> }
>
> public static TestSuite suite()
> {
> TestSuite result =3D new TestSuite();
>
> // Labs
> //result.addTest(LabAdvisorKeywordSearchTest.suite() );
> result.addTest(LabAdvisorTopicSearchTest.suite() );
>
> // Added by HCL
> result.addTest(LabDatabaseSearchExtendedTest.suite() );
> result.addTest(LabDatabaseSearchTest.suite() );
> result.addTest(LabDatabaseSearchThirdTest.suite() );
>
> return result;
> }
> }
>
> Thanks for any guidance you can provide
>
> Jeff
>
>
>
>
>
>
